item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Stop Animal Fat Tax Credits Act of 2017

This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to make fuels derived from animal fats ineligible for the tax credits for: (1) biodiesel and renewable diesel, and (2) alternative fuels.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WEBER of Texas:H.R. 1866.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Aticle I, Section 8, Clause 1: The Congress shalls havePower to lay and collect Taxas, Duties, Imposts and Excises,to pay the Debts and provide for the common defence andgeneral Welfare of the United State; but all Duties, Impostsand Excises shall be uniform throughout the United States.[Page H2630]

item.title: Stop Animal Fat Tax Credits Act of 2017
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow certain biodiesel and alternative fuel tax credits for fuels derived from animal fats.
Stop Animal Fat Tax Credits Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
